message.body: Hello
Ho, how's it going?
Not bad. weather isnt as bad as they made it seem, so very thankful for that lol
How's your day going so far??
I been busy, we're waiting for the heat wave. Are you in philly?
Yes.
Wasn't it supposed to star today??
I'm in boston, we're getting it tomorrow. What do you do in philly?
My phone is telling me it's 97Â° outside :-(
I'm a part time teacher
Dang! We're supposed to get 95 tomorrow. And muggy to boot!
Awesome! Which school?
I worked in a few high schools and junior high schools in after school debate programs when I was in college
In a private academy. I also am a private tutor for brothers in 4th and 2nd grade
Debate programs?? How do those go??
They're closing a bunch of schools here
Nice - i worked in a few of the public schools
How do you like philly?
Hate it
I'm dying to move
Economy is bad and poverty is at its best here
They were really fun - it was through a group called Penn For Youth Debate, we worked in public schools without debate programs
My family and I are doing well but I hate living here
Ahh I see
That's too bad - i really miss it - it has a much better sense of inclusion than other cities
It has a lot of potential for improvement!
I really hope so. This city is home for me. I would love to see it improve but poverty and violence is only getting worse
So what do you doin Boston??
I work at a not for profit health care organization - we try to find and share the best ideas to improve care
Nice!! Good luck
Anything in particular that you're working on now??
Yeah - we're trying to engage employers as purchasers of care to use their leverage to decrease costs while maintaining quality
In the US, 30% of our spend is waste - we spend more and get worse results than all other OECD countries
We think part of our complacency I because employers just accept that they will spend more and more each year as a fixed cost. We're trying to change that complacency
Good luck
How long did you live in Philly??
Only for four years while I was in college - i'm hoping to get back at some point - my wife just graduated with her jd which is why we came to boston
Oh I see
What are some parts of the city that you remember??
How about you?
I worked in William penn near temple, i lived in west philly - dock street brewery is one of my favorite places! I really liked the mish-mash of culturesin west philly
You don't get that in boston
Have you always lived in philly?
Born and raised in North Philadelphia
I lived over seas in Palestine for 3 years when I was 6-9. I dont recall much however
Nice, I'd love to live overseas
Are you looking to other cities currently?
I would love to move to a nice country overseas...currently I'm not looking. I'm not going to move alone. Waiting for the right man to move with me lol
I makes it easier and more fun!
And someone to do it with instead of moving alone and living alone
Definitely - do you follow any of the philly music scene?
I dont actually
You have to check out Dr. Dog - phillys phinest!
I'll look into it
They're great, they're just starting to take off on a more mainstream level
Also, as a teacher you may be interested in litographs.com
It's my best friend's business - an entire book on one poster
Where would I find them??
Thats pretty cool. I dont have my own classroom, but I might know a few people that would be interested.
